bug.short_desc: regression vs yum: dnf --enablerepo does not accept comma-separated list of repos
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
yum "--enablerepo=" accepts a comma-separated list of repositories, eg: yum --enablerepo=repo1,unglobbable2,balls3,meh4 install blah
dnf does not accept a comma-separated list, making it necessary to write nonsense like this:
dnf --enablerepo=repo1 --enablerepo=unglobbable2 --enablerepo=balls3 --enablerepo=meh4 install blah
It's madness.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
I'm using dnf-1.1.10-5.fc25.noarch
This regression vs yum has been present since dnf was first introduced, and it is long past the time to fix it.
How reproducible: Easily, with much gnashing of teeth.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf --enablerepo=fedora-debuginfo,fedora-source list 2. cry
Actual results: Error: Unknown repo: 'fedora-debuginfo,fedora-source'
Expected results: The list of repos is enabled, and command works.
Additional info:

I should note, that this regression is not documented at: http://dnf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli_vs_yum.html
I can only assume it's not documented there, because this issue is a sort of "secret shame", the existence of which, no one associated with dnf can bring themselves to admit - even though no one can bring themselves to bother fixing it.
It's time to fix this issue though. Come on guise.
This bug has been fixed in DNF 2.0 for quite some time. It's available in Rawhide and will be default in F26 release.
Yay, praise be to the gods.
